intro: Nectandra matudae, commonly known as the Matudá nectandra, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Lauraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces dark brown, woody fruits that contain elliptical seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
